# Silver Notebook for txmykw01 -> product
Hard-coded version for demonstration purposes

Here is a good guide on how to use spark notebooks https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/synapse-analytics/spark/apache-spark-development-using-notebooks

%%sql
SELECT DISTINCT
    prtp AS ProductID
    , prtpdesc AS ProductDescription
FROM bronze.txmykw01
Once done figuring out the logic, put it into spark.sql and register as dataframe

transformed_df = spark.sql(
    """
SELECT DISTINCT
    prtp AS ProductID
    , prtpdesc AS ProductDescription
FROM bronze.txmykw01
    """

Write out the dataframe to a physical location on the data lake in delta parquet format. Writing this in subsequent runs will create a new version - it's not like trunc and replace, we just write the new version of the table on top. You can set the maximum version history you would like to keep.

# write out table as delta
transformed_df.write.format('delta')\
    .option ('mergeSchema', 'true')\
    .option("overwriteSchema", "True")\
    .mode("overwrite")\
    .save('abfss://silver@nmdemostorage1.dfs.core.windows.net/delta_files/salesrusdb1/product')

Now we need to expose these delta files in our lake database to easily query with Serverless and Spark SQL. We basically create metadata about the location of the delta files, and wrap it in familiar db.table reference.

More info here https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/synapse-analytics/metadata/table

%%sql
-- create the lake database if it does not exist
CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS silver

%%sql
-- create the delta reference
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS silver.product
    USING DELTA
--      OPTIONS ( key1=val1, key2=val2, ... ) 
--      PARTITIONED BY ( col_name1, col_name2, ... ) 
--      CLUSTERED BY ( col_name3, col_name4, ... ) 
--          SORTED BY ( col_name  ASC | DESC , ... )  
--         INTO num_buckets BUCKETS 
    LOCATION 'abfss://silver@nmdemostorage1.dfs.core.windows.net/delta_files/salesrusdb1/product'
--      COMMENT table_comment
